dialogues.text: Shit, get him in your car and take him to St. Vincents. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever see that concert footage of the Doors, Sarg? Adelle and the room of officers look confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doors, the musical group.  I saw a documentary where the police stopped one of their concerts, snatched Jim Morrison right off the stage... the crowd went frickin nuts -- they tore up the place -- it turned into a war. (beat) ... I'm not stopping this concert by myself.  And there's no way you're getting backup here -- it's jammed up for miles. Emory is thinking fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we just let him finish Sarg? Beat.  Emory looks at Adelle's expectant face.  He talks the C.B. without taking his eyes off her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does he look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like shit.  He's bleeding heavily. He's having breathing problems and he's as pale as stone.  If he wasn't moving, I'd swear he was dead. Emory thinks.  He talks to the other officers in the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him in.  Now!  If he dies out there, who the hell knows what that crowd will do... (to himself) Let alone the Mayor. The room empties fast.  Emory talks to Adelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be in a hospital within a half an hour. Somehow, Adelle's face doesn't convey much confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shops are empty.  The food court abandoned. Close to five hundred people are huddled at the center of mall.  The HI-FI HOUSE has four large screen TV's in thei bay windows and speakers on the outside of the doors to l passing shoppers in. All four sets have the same program on -- A NEWSBREAK on Maurice Parker.  The crowd listening anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He's headed West on Sharp Park Road... Witnesses describe him as seriously injured. A shock of concern shoots through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynn McCay and our Highway Cam -- has just spotted him... The picture cuts to a HELICOPTER SHOT OF DOWNTOWN PACIFIC at first it just looks like an aerial of buildings, then camera ZOOMS.  It catches a tiny figure struggling throug street intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Newspapers spiral through the air.  Maurice stretches his neck up, squinting at the sun.  The SILHOUETTE OF A HELICOPTER hovers above him.  The NOISE is overpowering. Maurice's fatigue grows, every muscle, every ounce of ene goes into each step.  Maurice clutches the side of his head... the steps halted... hands trembling, teeth clench eyes squeezed shut.  A surge of intense pain tries to buc him... Maurice fights it off as he moves his feet again. The helicopter SWOOPS above as he makes his turn onto a F STRETCH OF ROAD adjacent to the BEACH. Maurice stops dead in his tracks as he turns the corner t find a SEA OF PEOPLE WAITING FOR HIM.  A momentous sight. people lined along the street for as far as the eye can s

dialogues.speaker: AN EXPLOSION OF YELLING, CHEERING CALIFORNIAN'S ENGULFS T
dialogues.text: AIR as they spot Maurice standing at the end of the stree The CROWD SURGES TOWARDS HIM. Maurice is dazed... the noise, the pain, the faces swirl his head as thousands of people surround him.  Maurice is overwhelmed.  He is about to collapse when someone takes of his arm.  Maurice turns to see KRIS REDDY STANDING NEX HIM.  In the midst of this chaos and growing madness. Maurice and Kris have an entire conversation with one emotional look. The SOUNDS of SIRENS BREAK the moment.  Kris turns to see police cars turn on the street behind them. Kris turns to Maurice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't stop walking. Kris lets go of his arm and moves like lightning.  He jum atop a fire-hydrant and yells to the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are here.  They're coming to take Mr. Parker away.  He needs our help. Kris points to the squad cars inching their way up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help Mr. Parker!  Don't let them end the walk.

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD CARS
dialogues.text: AS THEY COME TO A HALT as a wall of people stand in their way.  The SPEAKER ON THE POLICE CAR BLARES THROUGH THE AI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step aside now!  You are ordered to step aside now! The people don't move.  A WOMAN carrying a BABY makes the baby move her little hand in a waving gesture to the offi behind the wheel of the police cars.  The officers look a each other in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The far end of the beach road.  A POLICE CAR SCREECHES TO STOP.  Sergeant Emory and Adelle get out. Adelle is completely blown away.  She looks around at the PANDEMONIUM.  Thousands of men, women and children celebrating with APPLAUSE AND CHEERS, HELICOPTERS IN THE camera crews standing on raised platforms.  Adelle drinks the ELECTRIC ATMOSPHERE with awe. Emory yells orders into his WALKIE-TALKIE as Adelle break the outer edge of the crowd and disappears into the field spectators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) What the hell is going on?  It's frickin wall to wall people and they're way too emotional.  We need mucho backup -- now!... Officers are to bring in Mr. Parker on sight, don't ask questions, don't hesitate, bring him in... I want a barricade placed along the entire beach area... Now God damn it, now! Emory CLICKS OFF and looks around at the growing crowd -- turns to see a PUBLIC BUS UNLOADING PASSENGERS -- fifty m spectators rush off the bus and rush toward the crowded street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice stares down at the ground... willing each new ste

dialogues.speaker: UNDISTINGUISHABLE SOUND.
dialogues.text: Maurice looks up for a moment as something grabs his attention -- Maurice gasps for air as his eyes focus... T small faces become clearer... Maurice stands twenty feet the entire population of PACIFICA HIGH SCHOOL.  They cove one side of the street for an entire block.  Stretched ov their heads, held up by twenty students is a HUGE HAND PAINTED BANNER.  Maurice reads the words:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trucks unload dozens upon dozens of blue-wooden barricade An assembly line of officers place the barricades end to at the place where the sand meets the pavement. Emory yells orders as a new truck arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Through ten states and over three thousand miles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... A bookstore owner from Philadelphia Pennsylvania...

dialogues.speaker: FATHER BERCHMAN
dialogues.text: the father that brought Maurice in out of the cold in the Midwest, praying intensely in his chapel.  AN OLD HAND-HE RADIO IS ON THE PEW NEXT TO HIM.  He listens to the updat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Ellen Parker killed by a drunk driver September 2nd...

dialogues.speaker: MR. CALDWELL
dialogues.text: Isaac's father, sitting in a TV station watching the moni as the feeds come in from California.  Mr. Caldwell watch with great emotion, eyes glued to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... A seven month odyssey through the heart of the country...

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT DALLY
dialogues.text: the police officer from Philadelphia who worked with Adel He listens with the rest of the precinct to a portable st on a windowsill.  The room is silent -- everyone hangs on words coming from the speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the power of the human spirit...

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: in a hotel room.  The TV FILLING THE ROOM WITH NEWS.  Ger sits behind two large room-service carts of food.  He tak big bite of a sandwich with an emotional smile to the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... A life threatening condition, Transient Cerebral Ischemia...

dialogues.speaker: ST. VINCENT'S HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: where STEPHANIE watches in the jam packed recreation room with about thirty patients watching a TV screen mounted h in the corner of the room.  Stephanie looks a mess, she's been crying for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... a journey he began by himself, will end with a family of millions at his side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOISTEROUS crowd parts like a ripple effect as Mauric walks through.  The eyes fall emotionally on him as he st down at the ground trying to keep moving. Maurice gasps harder now, his eyes stinging with drops of sweat falling from his brow.  People in the crowd cover t mouths in shock as they get a clear view of him... His sh soaked on one side with blood, his entire body shaking wi pain, and exhaustion, his face hollow and pale -- ghostly Maurice stops in his tracks.  He looks up at a wooden sig worn from the years of salt water air.  The sign reads:

dialogues.speaker: "PACIFICA BEACH
dialogues.text: Maurice's thoughts fade away from this place, this time..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE ARE IN THE PARKER BEDROOM.  The lights are off.  The MOONLIGHT FROM THE WINDOWS BLANKETS Young Maurice and You Ellen as they lay in bed.  Ellen is cradled in Maurice's arms.  She is awake and watching the shadows dance on the ceiling.  She speaks in whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think heaven is like? Maurice opens his eyes and stares at his beautiful wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's a different place for each person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have a dream? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where my heaven is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pacifica, California. Maurice chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was ten, my family lived in Pacifica for a year.  I used to go to the beach everyday that summer. I never felt so happy, carefree. It was a magic place for me... That's where my heaven will be. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I die, you'll know where to look for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep Ellen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No really, if God takes us away from each other, you know where to look now? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pacifying her) The beach of Pacifica, California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep Ellen. Ellen smiles as she cradles deeper into Maurice's arms. Husband and wife fall asleep together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice snaps back to the present, the PAIN AND COMMOTION come back in a tidal wave of reality. Maurice wipes the tears in his eyes and tries to take a s Someone blocks his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Maurice, please, we have to get you to a hospital. Adelle looks at her wounded Uncle sadly.  She touches his shirt and her hand comes away with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to finish first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let you die. The inner circle of people bursts open, as KRIS BREAKS THROUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him finish Adelle.  He's almost there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) He's almost dead.  Can't you see that!  This has nothing to do with you. Maurice touches Adelle's cheek turning her attention back him.  He barely manages to get the words out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has nothing to do with you either... This is between Ellen and me. Beat.  Maurice begins crying uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm begging you... Maurice takes her hand and bends down putting his forehea her hand as if getting blessings from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me do this for Ellen, let me do this for my wife. Adelle's heart is breaking.  She weeps openly as she straightens her Uncle to an upright position.  She wipes tears from his eyes with her hand gently.

dialogues.speaker: AT THAT MOMENT THE INNER CIRCLE BREAKS OPEN AS TWO OFFICE
dialogues.text: RUSH IN.  They reach for Maurice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touch him, and they'll be a riot... Adelle stands firm, the strength in her growing with each second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and I'll start it. The officers are taken off guard.  They look around at th countless sea of eyes on them.  Adelle sees they won't do anything and moves to Maurice's side. Maurice begins to walk again.  Adelle to one side, Kris t the other and thousands of people following in step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wave of people led by Maurice walk toward the beach. beach is blocked off by barricades all along it's perimet Police officers stand every ten feet along it's edge. A young officer watches fearfully as the ocean of people towards him.  OFFICER GANTZ TALKS INTO HIS WALKIE-TALKIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming.  What should I do?

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT EMORY
dialogues.text: at the other end of the beach barricade, holding back hundreds of people trying to get to the beach.  Emory hol his walkie-talkie and looks around at the sea of anxious faces.  He makes eye contact with a woman in tears.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER GANTZ
dialogues.text: clicking off his walkie-talkie as the crowd presses up to barricade.  Officer Gantz is in awe as Maurice appears fr the crowd -- looking like a ghost of war... a holy apparition.  Maurice works his way painfully to Gantz. Gantz looks into Maurice's pleading eyes.  Maurice tries say something, but nothing can come out... Gantz turns away from Maurice and picks up one of the barricades.  He makes an opening about three feet wide. Gantz turns back to Maurice, stands at attention, and ste aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
